alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 4:44PM MST until August 11 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 745 PM MST. * At 444 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Supai. Between 0.25 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Hualapai Hilltop, Havasupai Reservation and Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Royal Arch Creek, Colorado River, Havasu Creek, Hundred and Twentyseven Mile Creek, Tapeats Creek, Deer Creek, Hundred and Twenty Mile Creek, Jumpup Canyon, Pasture Wash, Shinumo Creek, Little Coyote Canyon, Sowats Canyon and Hundred and Twentyeight Mile Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
